did.unittitle: Mortimer Gellis Insurance Workers International Union Papers
did.physdesc: Reports, pamphlets, correspondence, constitutions, news clippings, photographs.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mortimer Gellis Insurance Workers International Union Papers #6401. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

Union By-Laws
Item 1: By-laws of the Industrial Insurance Employees Union, Local 30, United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO
Item 2: By-laws of the Industrial Insurance Employees Union, Local 30, United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO
Item 3: By-laws of the Industrial Insurance Employees Union, Local 30, United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dated June 19, 1947 with handwritten edits changing the local union to Local 1706 of the Industrial Insurance Employees Union

did.unittitle: Item 4: Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO Proposed By-Laws Amendments

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dealing with the number of full time officers and the rights of officers to receive a pension from the Union. Amendments to take effect March 1, 1969.

did.unittitle: Item 5: Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO Proposed By-Laws Amendments

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dealing with the number of full time officers and the rights of officers to receive a pension from the Union. Amendments to take effect March 1, 1969. Copy 2.

did.unittitle: Item 6: By-laws of Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO
Item 7: Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO Proposed By-Laws
Item 8: Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO Proposed By-Laws
Item 9: Proposed Additions and Amendments to Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO By-Laws
Item 10: Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO Proposed By-Laws
Item 11: Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO Proposed By-Laws
Item 12: Proposed By-Laws Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO
Proposed By-laws of Local 5, Insurance Workers International Union, merging Local 19 and Local 1706 as well as proposed amendments
Contract between the Insurance Agents International Union, AFL-CIO and the Prudential Insurance Company of America
Information on Premium Rates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Insurance form 398. National Service Life Insurance

did.unittitle: Documents dealing with voluntary arbitration between the Insurance Workers International Union, AFL-CIO and the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Including the Memorandum for the Union dated May 9, 1961 and the Award of the Arbitrator dated September 18, 1961

did.unittitle: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company Court and NLRB Cases
Item 1: Ruling of the National War Labor Board Region II

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dated September 15, 1943 in the matter of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company and the Industrial Insurance Agents Union, Local 30, United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO

did.unittitle: Item 2: Statement by Leroy A. Lincoln, President of Metropolitan Life Insurance Company to the National War Labor Board

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dated September 18, 1944. Dealing with the decision concerning compensation of agents

did.unittitle: Item 3: Escrow Agreement

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 29, 1944. Between Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO, the Escrowees, and Manufacturers' Trust Company, Depositary.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Ruling of the United States District Court, Southern District of New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dated June 12, 1946 in the matter of Paris, Rogers, Mfyrich, Levy, Schechter, and Rosenbaum, Plaintiffs against Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, Berney, North, and Nicholas, Defendants

did.unittitle: Item 5: Letter from R. P. Lawrence, Second Vice-President, Metropolitan Life Insurance Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: June 14, 1949. Regarding negotiations with UOPWA over the Escrow fund.

did.unittitle: Item 6: Decision of the National Labor Relations Board

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dated November 10, 1950 in the matter of Metropolitan Life Insurance Company and United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO, Case No.2-CA-992

did.unittitle: Item 7: Documents dealing with a court case heard in the US District Court , Southern District of NY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Plaintiffs were agents and former agents of Metropolitan Life Insurance Company; defendants were Metropolitan Life Insurance Company and several officers of the company

did.unittitle: Correpondence
Item 1: To "Bro Ellis"
Item 2: William O. Murdock, Director of Industrial Relations, John Hancock Life Insurance Company, to M. Gellis President, Local 1706, IWIU, AFL-CIO

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: October 19, 1959. Dealing with disputes between the company and the union

did.unittitle: Item 3: Esther Helfgott, widow of Simon Helfgott

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: May 3, 1959 accompanied by a letter of the same date to the Officers and Executive Board of Local 1706, IWA, AFL-CIO, acknowledging the dedication of room in the union office in memory of her late husband.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Joe McGoldrick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: May 26, 1960 on the occasion of a testimonial dinner for Mr. McGoldrick

did.unittitle: Item 5: Patrick J. Drury, John Hancock Life Insurance Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: May 3, 1962 on the occasion of Mr. Drury's retirement

did.unittitle: Item 6: C. Hauens

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: November 1962 acknowledging assistance given by the union

did.unittitle: Item 7: 18 Telegrams sent to M. Gellis on the occasion of a testimonial dinner in his honor
Item 8: Irving Abramson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: December 15, 1964. Regarding testimonial dinner on December 10, 1964.

did.unittitle: Item 9: Leon W. Berney, C.L.U. and M. Gellis, President of Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO
Item 10: W. Edward Kane
Item 11: Mortimer Gellis and William Gillen, President of the Insurance Workers International Union, AFL-CIO

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: October 15, 1969. Dealing with the rights of retired union members

did.unittitle: Item 12: Irving Abramson
Item 13: Mortimer Gellis and William Gillen, President of the Insurance Workers International Union, AFL-CIO
Item 14: David J. Fitzmaurice, Secretary-Treasure, International Union of Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers
Item 15: Irving Abramson
Item 16: Frank B. Miller, President and CEO, John Hancock Insurance
Item 17: Irving Abramson
Item 18: Irving Abramson
Item 19: Joseph Pollack, President of the Insurance Workers International Union, AFL-CIO
Item 20: Charles G. Heisel, Secretary-Treasurer of the Insurance Workers International Union, AFL-CIO
Item 21: Frank H. Zaruba, President of Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO
Item 22: Mortimer Gellis to Rob Robinson, editor of the Insurance Worker magazine (IWIU, AFL-CIO)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: January 1, 1981. Dealing with the history of the union in the 1950's including events leading up to the merger of the two insurance workers unions and a handwritten transcript of remarks by M. Gellis at a union meeting July 14, 1955 dealing with the elect

did.unittitle: Item 23: William (Bill) Butler

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: February 25, 1981 in response to item #10. It appears that following the letter from M. Gellis to Rob Robinson a subsequent article was published in the Insurance Worker magazine.

did.unittitle: Item 24: Anthony (Tony) Crima

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: March 18, 1981 responding to a March 10 letter from M. Gellis on the occasion of Mr. Crima's retirement

did.unittitle: Union Circulars
Item 1: Aaron D. Schneider, Greater New York Regional Council, United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO, to All Local Union Organizers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: August 8, 1949. Regarding the NY area to protest the trial of 12 Communists.

did.unittitle: Item 2: Aaron D. Schneider, Greater New York Regional Council, United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO, to All Local Union Organizers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 12, 1949. Regarding the NY area to protest the trial of 12 Communists.

did.unittitle: Item 3: Aaron D. Schneider, Greater New York Regional Council, United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO, to All Local Union Organizers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: October 4, 1949. Regarding the NY area to protest the trial of 12 Communists.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Letter dated December 8, 1950 from Malcolm C. Young, Second Vice-President of John Hancock Mutual Life Insurance Company to District Agents.
Item 5: Jack Belser to the membership of Local 1706 endorsing M. Gellis for president of the local.
Item 6: John J. Provenzano regarding the 1969 Union election
Item 7: William A. Gillen regarding amended constitution
Union Publications
Item 1: The Daily Worker
Item 2: The CIO Debit

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official Publication of the Industrial Insurance Employees Union, Local 1706, IAWOC, CIO dated December 1950

did.unittitle: Item 3: Newsletter of Local 1706, Industrial Insurance Employees Union, CIO

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes mention of Local 30 UOPWA as well as the lifting of the "Negro ban"

did.unittitle: Item 4: Publication of the UOPWA (DPOWA)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: from early 1951 reflecting the dispute with the IAWOC, CIO.

did.unittitle: Item 5: The AFL-CIO Insurance Worker
Item 6: The Insurance Worker

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Magazine published by the Insurance Workers of America , AFL-CIO dated March 1959; much of the issue is devoted to the forthcoming merger of the IWA and the Insurance Agents International Union.

did.unittitle: Item 7: The AFL-CIO Insurance Worker
Item 8: The AFL-CIO Insurance Worker
Meeting Minutes
Local 5 IWIU Executive Board Minutes and Other Documents
Item 1: Local 5 IWIU Executive Board Minutes
Item 2: Local 5 IWIU Executive Board Minutes
Item 3: Local 5 IWIU Executive Board Minutes
Item 4: IWIU, AFL-CIO Financial Statements
Item 5: Information sent to union members concerning 1978 negotiations between IWIU, AFL-CIO and Metropolitan Life Insurance Company.
Property at no.39-40 Glenwood Ave., Little Neck, NY.
Item 1: Plat of 39-40 Glenwood Ave.
Item 2: Statement of Closing of Title to Premises 39-40 Glenwood Ave.
News Clippings
Item 1: New York Times obituary dated June 20, 1965 for Lewis Merrill, a former leader of UOPWA.
Item 2: Article from the Wall Street Journal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dated March 7, 1968 dealing with a Supreme Court decision that insurance salesmen/commission agents are "employees" within the scope of the National Labor Relations Act and as such cleared the way for union organizing attempts .

did.unittitle: Item 3: A long article from the New York Times Magazine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dated November 14, 1971 profiling the career of Leonard Boudin, a well-known attorney who defended left-wing activists and causes.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Metropolitan Life's Failure as a Swingerr
Membership cards
Item 1: United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO Industrial Insurance Agents Union division
Item 2: United Office and Professional Workers of America, CIO Industrial Insurance Agents Union division
Item 3: Insurance Workers International Union, AFL-CIO
Item 4: Insurance Workers International Union, AFL-CIO
Item 5: Insurance Workers International Union, AFL-CIO
Poem
ILR Song Sheets
Photographs
Item 1: A photo of President Franklin D. Roosevelt signing a document; date unknown; among those present is Francis Perkins.
Item 2: Photograph apparently of the officers and Executive Board of the IWIU, AFL-CIO

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: circa mid-1960s. Includes Mortimer Gellis and Edward Kane among others.

did.unittitle: Item 3: Photograph apparently of the officers and leadership of Local 5, IWIU, AFL-CIO

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dated January 7, 1965 signed by George A. Rollins. Includes Eugen Lefeure, Mortimer Gellis, Edward Kane, and Mimis Therry among others.

did.unittitle: Item 4: Photograph of Mortimer Gellis and two others
